answers.answer: Same for me my son turned one in july , & im due October 2nd c section again.  My 1st one wasn't bad at all I just remember how everything felt so it kinda bothering me :/
I was put to sleep my firsr one this one im nervous cause I dont want that thing that makes your body numb for like hours.
I had the eepidrual block last week during my c section and it only took about an hour to get full feeling back and it was pretty awesome to be awake while my baby was bring born

Yeah I wasn't asleep during mine either.Just the healing gots me thinking like laughing coughing :/ then my one year old likes to get silly and of course won't know to be gentle with me :/ inly things I been thinking bout other then that im ready
Ugh yes it hurt so much to laugh cough or sneeze!!! Recovery from a section is really annoying lol
Lol yes.  I use to cry when people made me laugh :/ just ready to get this over withh when are you due ?
My fear is somthing going.wrong during the csection im due feb 4 but there only letting me go to 37 weeks cause of my first pregnancy I had preeclampsia high blood pressure

I highly respect a cesarean delivery!! I probably wouldn't have been able to be a mother had it not been for such an operation!! I due for my 7th cesarean delivery the 16th of (originally the 17th but got rescheduled). I had 6 completely successful and healthy cesarean deliveries!! I no longer fear the outcome or the C-section itself, I actually have a dislike for the spinal tap other then that the surgery in general to me is a blessing!! The first cesarean delivery is difficult when it comes to recovery but after that generally speaking, it gets easier. More so because you know what to expect and how to handle each and every issue as it occurs. I am a bit nervous about my 7th cesarean delivery but because I am so worried about the baby and common complications that some time occur, like the baby ingesting fluid and needing extra time in a nursery or NICU. Other then that, I am very much ready!!! I plan on having one more child on s few years, definitely not back to back like my other children. My first born passed away (none birth related), but she was born in 2004. At home I have a 7 year old, almost 6 year old, 4 and a half year old, 3 year old and a 14 month old. I am 35 weeks. I personally think if a cesarean delivery is best for your situation as it was mine, then by all means be thankful that you get to deliver in general!! I hope your delivery goes well with no complications!! Blessings!

question: What are your thoughts on.csections I will be having my second one so nervous and I just had my last csection last year so.soon
title: csections
